Author: iceblink4
Text: i’m not positive i’m right about this but your BMR and TDEE (total daily energy expenditure) are different! BMR is like if you literally laid flat in bed all day and didn’t move whereas TDEE factors in the walking around/etc you do during the day. like i walk a fair amount to go to classes and i have physical therapy 2x a week, my BMR is something like 1300 but my TDEE is more like 1700 because of the activity i do on a daily basis. even if you’re mostly just sitting on the couch or whatever you’re at least doing a little exercise when you do get up so the amount of calories you expend every day is higher than your BMR unless, like i said, you literally spend 24 hours lying in bed motionless
